title: Top Ten Reasons To Holiday in Europe in AutumnTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Top Ten Reasons To Holiday in Europe in Autumn Published on : Wednesday, September 9, 2015
As families head back home for the start of the school season, many of Europe’s cities once again become a peaceful haven, free from crowds, queues and hassle. What’s more the weather is still great, there are plenty of events occurring and for food and drink lovers it’s harvest season!
With this in mind bmi regional has created a guide to the top 10 reasons to visit the fantastic European destinations serviced by the carrier. Amongst those on offer are:
Frankfurt, Munich, Milan, Dusseldorf, Paris, Brussels and Hamburg.
1. First and foremost prices are cheaper at this time of year – look anywhere on line for autumn breaks and there are endless offers and discounts. Book early to ensure the best prices which with bmi regional start from only £49 one way.
2. Make a catwalk entrance to the cities of Milan and Paris in September for the fashion weeks and previews of the hottest trends for 2016. Not only can you fly in style with bmi regional but with 20kg of luggage allowance included in the ticket price there is plenty of space to bring home any new purchases. Prices for a ticket to fly to the shows cost from £49 one way.
3. As the diet season comes to an end why not tuck into some of Europe’s most fantastic cuisine from the pasta of Italy and Bratwurst in Germany to great steaks in Paris. bmi regional also offers flights from Aberdeen to Oslo where from 11 – 12 September the city plays host to Norway’s largest annual food festival. Taste Nordic specialities with one way flights from only £87 one way.
4. It goes without saying that autumn cannot pass by without an annual pilgrimage to Munich for the wondrous Oktoberfest. Taking place from 19 September – 4 October, the event offers everything from family days and theatrical performances to tastings of some of Germany’s most famous beers. A one way flight from Bristol to Munich costs from £79.
5. While couples may travel to Paris for Valentine’s Day romance, autumn offers a much more special experience. The image of departing the UK on a cold day to land in Paris in the winter, where the autumn colours in the city parks create a truly romantic movie style setting.
6. Indulge in the best French wines in October at the Montmartre Grape Harvest Festival in Paris from 6 – 11 October. Do it in day with bmi regional’s convenient flight times or stay for the duration.
7. Take a flight to Oslo for a once in a lifetime opportunity to experience the incredible Aurora Borealis. Regularly seen in the skies above Norway from October onwards a flight to this unique spectacle costs from as little as £87 one way.
8. Take a look behind the scenes of Brussels’ Museums every Thursday throughout autumn when ‘Brussels Museum Nocturnes’ sees a number of places staying open late. Fly to Brussels from East Midlands or Newcastle with bmi regional from only £65 one way.
9. Have the place to yourselves as Europe enjoys its quiet season with fewer crowds….yet still enjoy balmy days of relatively long daylight hours and temperatures regularly in the high teens. Why not just visit bmiregional.com a take a lucky pick from your preferred autumn dates.
10. Finally, wait a little longer and travel in November. Christmas markets in the cities of Hamburg, Munich, Dusseldorf and Frankfurt all start in the last week of November. One way fares at this time start from £79
bmi regional offers flights to Europe from Bristol, East Midlands, Newcastle and Aberdeen. All fares include a full in-flight snack and bar service, 20kg of hold luggage and allocated seating.
Source:- bmi Regional
